website_summaries.verdict: For a classy-looking work boot, it doesn't get much better than this.
pros: No-lace leather uppers with a pull-on loop create a smooth look that provides excellent protection
These boots do a great job of keeping feet dry, and they're comfortable after hours of wear
cons: The pull loop isn't as durable as it could be

customer_reviews.title: They're comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid boot that I use for work. They're comfortable and sturdy. The only drawback other than general wear and tear from using them as work boots is that the ankle is large. Generally chelsea boots should'nt be very large around the ankle, they're supposed to fit skinny. But I can see how it was made bigger to be more universal. Either way, that's a minor criticism; they're great boots. I'd recommend them Update: 8moths later and the sole is peeling off Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Von Mises

customer_reviews.title: Update-- 4 to 0 stars
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are comfortable and fit as expected. Easy to get on and off. These boots also stay on well like a laced boot. No slipping in the heel which is a good thing. I would expect nothing less from Docs. Gave them a 4 until I see how they hold up. In six months I'll give the review an update on durability. Update 5/16/18. Downgraded to 1 star. After 1.5 months, the left boot came apart at the seam where the stretch fabric meets the leather near the inside ankle area. Comfort and fit-5 star Durability 0 star I need to look at another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C.

customer_reviews.title: Not What They Used To Be
customer_reviews.text: My husband had wore these boots since 2014,we have purchased a total of 5 pair since 2014. However, this pair by far was the worst pair to date. He can normally get about 2 years or of a pair of these. But don't this pair. These was purchased on 2017 and by 2018 we was buying him another pair. Then, before 2019 even started we was buying another pair. This time June 2020 we opted for him to switch to Ariat WorkHogs.
customer_reviews.author: Kandie Wood

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable, with little signs of wear after 1+ year
customer_reviews.text: These boots are awesome; I've had them for well over a year & I wear them near daily. They've held up great. Some scuffs on the toes, but nothing I wear will survive without scuffs. I was wary of a lace-less boot, but Dr. Martens got these just right. They slid on easily, but feel snug while wearing. I will point out, because of the lace-less fit, I cannot layer socks or wear winter socks comfortably; just too much in the boot. That said, these are amazingly comfortable and are my go-to if I know I'm going to be in boots all day (nearly every day).
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Safety
customer_reviews.text: Easy to slip on and off, which is why I bought them. Safety Toe foot wear is required at my job and these fit the bill perfectly. They are not as nice and shiney as when I bought them, but the yellow stitching is still bright. Very comfortable to wear all day long. I put some cushioning insoles in, which provides a little more bounce. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: dutch

customer_reviews.title: Decent in dry climate.
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a 5 star they fit well have a comfortable sole. Seem to be thin soft leather so I put toe tough on to add life, about two months into wearing them the outer sole septated and then today it finally really rained while I was at work and both my feet got soaked. Do away with the two part out sole.
customer_reviews.author: MUDDYPUNK

customer_reviews.title: Great for women too
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman and needed steel toe boots for a welding class I am taking at an art center. The sizing is based on men's shoes--be sure to click the size chart and order your EU size. I wear Birkenstock's in a size 39 (size 9) and hoped it would translate here--it did! Love the boots. Wore with some smart wool hiking socks and were very comfortable. We were learning to cut. I did notice I had a minor melt/indentation on the rubber sole bottom stepping on hot cut iron but it was no big deal--minor and as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DallasJulie

customer_reviews.title: SO. DAMN. COMFORTABLE.
customer_reviews.text: Man these boots are comfortable. It's only been about 2 weeks, but they look beautiful, are easy to put on though a bit tough to take off. I have a fused spine so I got these slip on boots, and I can just reach the back hook area for slipping them on, and just with a small pull they slip on very snug. Order as close to your normal shoe size as possible, they do not run big or small, but just as what your foot size is.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Steel Toe Boots
customer_reviews.text: I work in a manufacturing plant and need steel toe shoes. The options for women are quite limited, especially in slip-on styles. These look great over skinny jeans or under pants and are quite comfortable. I usually wear 8.5 in shoes and 9 in boots. These run quite big. I bought the 6 UK and there is plenty of room. Possibly could even gone down a size if I wore thin socks. I find this style more comfortable than the low cut slip-on style (Resistor ST). Recommended if you need a steel toe boot but you don't want it to look like a steel toe boot.
customer_reviews.author: D. TuxenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Ripped the second time putting them on?!
customer_reviews.text: Fit very tight across the top of the foot. Second time I put them on the pull tab of the left boot ripped. The sole of the right boot squeaks wth every step. VERY disappointed compared to my other pair of Docs.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy

customer_reviews.title: I love this pair
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of Doc's. I love this pair! I do not work in them, they are for everyday use, NOT work use. The right boot fit a little tight but my right foot is a little bigger. I have had 3 other pairs of Chelsea style boots and everyone of them the right boot fit tighter at first. If one is really tight, try freezing a gallon size storage bag full of water overnight in the tight boot. It will help stretch it and aid in the breaking in process.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Buy 'em
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, but I just got them several days ago and have not really had time to do a good test on them. Initial impressions are good. As to the fit, I noted that other comments mentioned them running large, so I ordered half a size smaller and they're just about right. I bought them to replace a pair of Georgia romeos which remained hard to get into after a year+. The side elastic was beginning to show clear signs of wear which neither the soles nor the lining was showing any. These Dr. Marten's seem to have better elastic and are much easier to pull on even right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Larspa

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good quality, and easy to change.
customer_reviews.text: A little large for a 12, but a Dr. Scholl's gel insert solved that. I work in an office environment but have to go out to a construction site regularly. These are classy enough to wear w/ khakis (business casual) and easy to quickly slip on if I'm wearing something else and need to visit the site in short notice. I do a lot of walking on the site so I needed something comfortable. These fit the bill. Based on my past experiences with Dr. Martens, I know these will last several years.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've worn so far
customer_reviews.text: I wear these at work only. I'm a firefighter so slipping boots on and off can suck with zipper and all that. Although there are many brands of station boots like this style out there. I think nothing beats the comfort of a good pair of docs. The last pair I bought was in 05. I used them for working and wearing around, so I figured what could be better comfort wise than a pair of docs for the fire house. Very happy with the purchase. Not heavy or super bulky. The air soles are awsome! Size is right on.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty much a flat sole
customer_reviews.text: These are the 3rd pair I have bought of these so clearly they are a decent enough boot to be worth the money. I've taken off a star due to the lack of arch support. These are pretty much a flat sole. You will need inserts if you require a more supportive sole. Secondly , the leather scrapes off the boot very easily leaving scuffs that can't be cleaned up by shining
customer_reviews.author: G A Wayadande

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy! Moderate to low comfort boot
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for over a year now. I pretty much stopped wearing them. The only time is when it rains. These are extremely heavy boots and the toe is excessively larger than what I fit in other steal toe'd boots. Look great, water proof but other than that, mid to lower grade boot.
customer_reviews.author: fat cat

customer_reviews.title: I have a large foot and didn't have to high of expectations that I would like them but these are a winner
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big doc fan. I wore the iron bridge steel toes for a few years and then the quality seemed to go way down. So Decided to try my first set of slip ons. I'm sold. I have a large foot and didn't have to high of expectations that I would like them but these are a winner. 6 months in, they still holding up well. They are a little hot, but they keep the foot dry when working in rain. I'll definitely order another pair when these wear out.
customer_reviews.author: FatFatallThat

customer_reviews.title: Quality, comfort, safety requirements
customer_reviews.text: I already knew to order one size larger (I wear 11 and ordered size 12 with Docs). I am on my feet for 12 hours a day in a Class I, Div. 1 factory that requires static dissipating and steel toe. It is hard to find a brand of boot that meets all requirements and is still comfortable for my wide feet. These are extremely comfy and as an added bonus, look great. A gentleman could walk straight out of work and spend a night walking around downtown. I will continue to purchase this make and model.
customer_reviews.author: Coralea

customer_reviews.title: These are great, steel toe and super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great, steel toe and super comfortable. I have two pairs of these now and use one for work and the other for going out, just a great boot that slips on. I am a contractor and have to go into many houses that ask me to remove my shoes before entering, these take 2.5 seconds to remove and put back on.
customer_reviews.author: M. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Really like these boots!
customer_reviews.text: Really like these boots! I have been wearing these for about 2 months, find them as comfortable as you can expect from a steel toe boot, and seem to be reasonably durable. I especially like that the toe box is large and squarish, so it doesn't rub on my toes or ruin socks like some steel toe boots do.
customer_reviews.author: Saranne Emery

customer_reviews.title: Good Boot but Made in China
customer_reviews.text: It could be the new leather but this shoe seems a tad slimmer than my old ones. Didn't have this style in the stores locally so had to order off line. I'm sure after a months of wear they will stretch out like the last ones. At $110 it seems like you could bring the production back to the USA and give some more folks jobs though. Cows are at an low so leather can't be that expensive.
customer_reviews.author: WR Pcola

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and comfortable protection
customer_reviews.text: Looks good. Very comfortable and cool. This is my 2nd pair. The old ones I wear at home when I split wood, fell trees, etc. They are brown and looked great, until I beat them up too much. I used to wear them at work. Now I wear the new, black ones to work. I work an office job, but need to go down on the plant floor occasionally. They both look great with khakis or jeans. Quick to slip on and off and my feet stay cool. I wear with thick cotton, or wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great for work
customer_reviews.text: These really are great work boots. Fit is perfect and they are comfortable. They are a little on the narrow side, but after only three days have broken in nicely. I am going to try some different insoles due to back problems, but the ones that come in the boot are not bad at all. I had the Rockport work boots for the last two years and these are a huge improvement. Do Not buy the Rockport Works. They are super heavy and no where near as comfortable as their regular shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I work on ships, and this is great shoe when working on deck or standing watch. I like the fact that these boots are slip on and that I can put them off/take them off at a moments notice.
customer_reviews.author: brasus13

customer_reviews.title: Finally......
customer_reviews.text: Relief - I wear a leg brace due to a condition known as "drop foot", for my personal needs these boots are awesome! There is room for the sole insert portion of my brace that includes a support bar.The tops are cut low enough to allow clearance of the brace straps. Most of all - BOTH of my feet are comfortable in these boots, I am active and these babies are sweet! Finally found a pull on that works for me!
customer_reviews.author: greggo617

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable boots. No half sizes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable boots. No half sizes, but even these felt a bit on the large side. Disappointed a bit in the sole. Has like a two piece sole, clear rubber and yellow rubber. The clear rubber has some narrow "straps" that go over the yellow, and the yellow part protrudes. But the clear pieces have broken in a couple spots already. Not sure how it affect them in a few more months, but I expected better from Dr. Martens. My other boots have lasted several years without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisr

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 3 months
customer_reviews.text: In 3 months of noteven daily use the material in one of the boots has folded under the toe and is pressing on my foot. Not sure if it's a fluke or their quality has went down.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great tractor/Farm boots.
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well-made, Time will tell. I love the look and the feel of the materials, if it is a little large for me. I have wide feet so that part is right but it Feels like it’s slipping a bit in the heel.It may just be that I haven’t had a new pair of boots in 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. DeNoon II

customer_reviews.title: Safety toes fit for a production queen!
customer_reviews.text: I work in cosmetics production and a pair of industrial steel-toes are de rigeur. These fit like a glove, gently and are so stylish enough that I usually wear them well into the weekend-- plus, my toes are intact and I have no barking dogs at the end of a shift. If I ever need to replace them, I'll absolutely be purchasing another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Baker

customer_reviews.title: Still love em though
customer_reviews.text: No half sizes but still fit well. After about 8 months working 55 hours a week. You'll notice holes on the back side of your socks.. oh well the price to pay for slip ons! Still love em though. Super comfortable and made to last!
customer_reviews.author: Pumpdoc

customer_reviews.title: These boots have been GREAT. I am on my feet for most of ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots have been GREAT. I am on my feet for most of my work shift and these hold up well. I replaced the insoles with a set of SuperFeet insoles, so I can't speak to the quality of the original ones. Despite replacing the insoles, the anti-static properties remained the same. I will wear these till they fall apart and then buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, recommending
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes, use it at my work. May be a little bit heavy, but this is working shoes. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Busikolmat

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots! Fit perfect and so comfortable right out of the box. Best work boot I've had yet and I've owned multiple pairs of Blundstone and Red wings. I'm always looking for a slip on boot because it's very convenient for entering in and out of homes. The oil resistant anti slip sole is great any time you come you need to work in a garage floor or commercial kitchen space. Solid boot for a great price. Thanks Doc!
customer_reviews.author: Jusafari

customer_reviews.title: An amazing pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: An amazing pair of boots! I wear all makes of boots - Bluntstones, RM Williams etc, but these Docs rate, in my opinion, as the best of the best!! I am 195cm tall and weigh a strong 115kgs. I live and work in Africa and spend all day on my feet on the mines. Conditions are hot, rugged and testing . . . rocks, sand, oil, water, mud, rain . . . . . need I say more?? I bought the UK13 or USA14 and fits me perfectly. Extremely HAPPY with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but not without issue.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in 02/2014 for industrial use. I do plenty of walking, climbing, and bending so these took a lot of stress. They are easy to put on and remove, which is very useful when going through TSA. After a little over a year of wear, one of the boots rubber sole had separated. I continued to wear it like that for a few months and recently repaired it using some shoe glue. Overall, these were good looking and comfortable. I would've hoped for them to last longer than a year before the sole separated but hopefully this glue fix will extend the life of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: J. Keo

customer_reviews.title: Great Docs for the price, can't beat a steel toe slip on
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little time to get them broken in. I have a wide foot, and it didn't cause me too much pain or discomfort getting them broken in. USe a hair dryer to heat up the leather and work them in with your hands, and then wear them around the house doing everyday things. Then they were ready for the street after a day or two of that kind of thing. this is my second pair. I'd buy a third.
customer_reviews.author: Dean R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit.
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is difficult to find a good fit. The boot has a lot of room inside of it and allows a lot of movement internally.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Love Dr Martens
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear at work. I've never ordered shoes online as you never really know how it will fit your feet. However, I was very happy that they are a perfect fit and are comfortable. They are more durable than my usual work boots that I get from Bates. I've banged up the toe several times and the leather hasn't split or show any signs of wear. Great boot!
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A gift for a good friend and she loves them. She uses to make flying car prototypes.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well made!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Brown version of these boots and ordered these because I liked them so much. They are both sturdy and comfortable once worn in. I use them when I ride my motorcycle to class and generally walk 3-4 miles a day in them. I would rate 5 stars but they do blister the back of my heel during the wear in period. Overall, I will probably purchase this style again as they are well made and comfortable for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Woogerths

customer_reviews.title: I really like these. I've been wearing them for several months ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I've been wearing them for several months now and have only one issue: I wish they would make half-sizes. Wearing 2 pair of socks helps, but who wants to wear 2 pair of sock during the summer? I am an aircraft mechanic, so these get plenty of oil, grease and etc.. I am on concrete all day and they are holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great slick pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Great slick pair of boots. They are a comfortable fit. I anticipated one size smaller then normal shoes for boots and was the perfect fit. I'm normally a size 13 but went with a size 12.
customer_reviews.author: jack jones

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Doc!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing but compliments on these boots and months down the road of heavy use still comfortable and looking good. I strongly recommend them! Once you get used to slip on boots you will love them too. They sometimes feel a little loose in the shin but always solid in the foot and ankle, just takes getting used to. I'm the envy of my coworkers in how easily I can slip them on and off.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stamand

customer_reviews.title: 😐
customer_reviews.text: They were a little to big but nothing an extra pair of insoles wouldn't take care of. Lasted all summer but not the same dr marten quality it used to be
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to getting years out of these and not months like other boots
customer_reviews.text: I replaced some red backs with these boots after being talked out of these Docs the first time. Never again, these boots outperform most boots I have worn. Looking forward to getting years out of these and not months like other boots. I am a first responder and can be on my feet in boots for up to 20-hrs a day and these boots are great. You will have to upsize since there are no half sizes but just buy some good sole inserts. Good boot.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line, sliiiightly snug but favorite boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my 3rd pair of these. The 1st pair were for work (construction), and I liked them so much, I bought a 2nd pair to wear as my every day wear/use boots. My company will reimburse me for a new pair of boots each year, so I just picked up a 3rd pair. Original pair still has some life in them. After 17 months, they have about 40% life left in them. So these easily last 2 years with moderate to hard daily use. They run a little narrow across the widest part of the foot. I have admittedly wide feet, and while these are slightly snug, they are still comfortable and great for 8-10 hour shifts.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: ... that I have retired it goes on and off easy as I am getting much
customer_reviews.text: Wore this type of boot while working in the railroad signal department held up well to the ballast and wet surfaces Now that I have retired it goes on and off easy as I am getting much older
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good weight, sturdy. Value for $$$
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good buy for the quality. Sturdy, comfortable and fits just right. I am a cook and this is just amazing. Do some walking to and fro work with these and as long as you have good socks, dam they feel and making. Easy to put on yet having a comfortable ankle support. Breaks in very easily too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These boots are pure awesomeness!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had walked into Academy and saw the Brown version of these boots and fell in love. The only bad thing is that I needed the Black pair and found them here. Since the side of the boot only goes up to the bottom of my calves, I no longer have to worry about the sweat on the back of my leg making the boot stick to my skin. Did I mention that these boots are awesome?
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Seperated and cracked where top is attached to sole
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots a year and a half ago. The top is separating from the sole on both shoes, in the same spots. I was expecting better life for the $120 that they cost. I really liked the fit... they are comfortable, easy to get on and off, and the steel toe saved my toes a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Moot

customer_reviews.title: Took longer than expencted to break into comfortable, I wore 3 pair of socks for 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Took longer than expencted to break into comfortable, I wore 3 pair of socks for 2 hours to stretch the leather, they now seem great, comfortable sole & thicker/nicer leather than what I've had 5 pairs of previously (Rossi's). I'm done with Rossi's, only get 1 year out of them & I'm only 150 lbs. We'll see how these hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Montaguefarmer

customer_reviews.title: Runs big
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe, well made, just way to big. Ladies if you are using the men’s/women’s sizing guide know that these don’t come in half sizes so they will run large.
customer_reviews.author: dferg

customer_reviews.title: My son loves these boots.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My son loves these boots. They are great for his work in the entertainment industry (sound, lighting and camera work). I have the piece of mind that he is a bit more protected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy. After 4 months of owning these boots the soul has given out. I have another pair of these and I hope they hold up. Can I get a new pair sent to me asap?
customer_reviews.author: Nate P.

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, long lasting, needs 1/2 size and wide.
customer_reviews.text: I wish these boots came in half sizes & wide, but because they do not i had to order 1/2 size larger and the boots still are too small at the ball of my foot on both sides. it will take some time to stretch the leather a bit but as soon as they are broken in i expect these boots to last as long as the last pair that i purchased. (3 years)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable workboot
customer_reviews.text: These fit true to size. My husband wears them standing most days on a shop (concrete) floor. He never complains of his arches hurting when he wears these, so I'd say they offer his foot the support they need. Great work boot.
customer_reviews.author: JBurg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Two months and they feel and look great. They are slightly large when compared to my other size 11 boots, but heavier socks easily fix this. I ordered a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: BBWY

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super light and comfortable for safety-toe shoes. Easy to put on and take off.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: I wear this every day. It's been 2 years. THEY STILL LOOK NEW! "5/5 Stars" has never been more deserved. I will buy these again if I ever need to but they way they last I might be buried with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Best deal!
customer_reviews.text: Love the way they look! They fit well. A little snug in the heal and top of foot. My foot is not narrow and not super wide. I wear size 11 USA/10 UK. I don't like blisters or discomfort braking in boots, so I sent them out to a leather repair shop to be broken in. Will update when I get them back!
customer_reviews.author: philip1000rr

customer_reviews.title: Runs big... Really big.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but they run a 1.5 sizes too big. The new tread pattern felt good too.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: the right one is fine. Fit good around the ankle
customer_reviews.text: These boots ran big. And the steel toe on the left boot digs into my foot, the right one is fine. Fit good around the ankle, I thought they would feel floppy.
customer_reviews.author: Missibug

customer_reviews.title: This is the most comfortable pair of work boots I have ever owned I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable pair of work boots I have ever owned I just got my second pair of them. I got two years out of the first pair working in the Quarry. Now I’m doing more driving and this pair should last a lot longer, It’s like wearing slippers all day very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Petermannn

customer_reviews.title: Decided on theese due to the price was cheap and quality seemed good. Once i recived them as expected
customer_reviews.text: Needed a 2nd pair of slip on boots for work. Decided on theese due to the price was cheap and quality seemed good. Once i recived them as expected, good quality and sturdy structure. Took next to nothing to break in. I recomend them , one thing is that they are a bit heavy but its ok i need the exercise.
customer_reviews.author: pelotas

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots though
customer_reviews.text: A little tight across the top of my foot and around heel. Nice boots though. I think that they'll break in well. If you're on the fence of normal or wide, buy wide. If you're on the fence between sizes, go bigger rather than smaller.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable, high quality boot!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my purchase! I ordered a half size up because I have somewhat wide feet. I can wear these all day with no fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy  Medrano

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my husband. He wanted a comfortable pair of boots that didn't require him to lace them every time he wore them. These fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: andys girl

customer_reviews.title: men's size 7 but the size 8 was a perfect fit. Broke in easily and look really good
customer_reviews.text: I'm a women's size 9, men's size 7 but the size 8 was a perfect fit. Broke in easily and look really good. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I dig em.
customer_reviews.text: Been years since I've owned Dr Martens but I now remember why they've always had a special place in my heart.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E.

customer_reviews.title: A bit heavy, but a great workboot.
customer_reviews.text: standard Doc Martens fit. Safety toe is a great feature, doesn't really scuff. Easy on/off. A bit heavy but that's to be expected. Will buy again when I have to.
customer_reviews.author: MightyRed

customer_reviews.title: Hitop Docs
customer_reviews.text: No laces. Steel toes. Doc Martins. These are great! Don't expect any ankle support though. It's stretchy material, so you can get you foot it them! They are great on wet floors and all that too. Docs are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Alex McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of boots I have ever owned that required no break in. Comfortable and ready to work right out of the box. I had been contemplating buying these for a few months. Don't know why I waited.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Salati

customer_reviews.title: And that's Good. WHY
customer_reviews.text: My Doc came fast and they are tight. And that's Good. WHY? Because Docs mold to your feet and loosen up. I am quite happy with them!
customer_reviews.author: Xon Mill

customer_reviews.title: DMs Chelsea boots
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pair of boots, the sole is so soft even softer than my other pair of doc martens boots. Really satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Florante a. Dizon

customer_reviews.title: I ordered size 11 and after a painful two days of wearing them they finally got broke ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought size 12 but was too large as I wear a 11.5 and the shoes are not offered in that size. I ordered size 11 and after a painful two days of wearing them they finally got broke in .
customer_reviews.author: JWR

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm always worried about mail ordering footwear as you never know about fit. I'm very happy with these boots despite being made in China. They fit well and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong Turn

customer_reviews.title: Boots that are seriously good for everyday.
customer_reviews.text: Boots look great. Little bit of a break in period. I wear red back slip on boots for work. Those have a serious break in period. These looked alarmingly huge when I pulled them out of the box. They're a little big. I get a lot of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Bro Montana

customer_reviews.title: awsume boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable. Cuz of the gel on the bottom. The only thing was they were a little tight for my husband he wearsa size 12. But maybe he just needs to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for working outside.
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase these boots for working outside! Within two weeks the yellow part of the sole separated from the rest of sole allowing dirt to fill the inside of the boot and making the sole bulge. Very disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jufer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Always my go-to! Always have been a Dr. Marten fan. Will always buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CalebBrian

customer_reviews.title: This pair is breaking in nicely and I am comfortable in the boots
customer_reviews.text: I have usually had success with Doc's. This pair is breaking in nicely and I am comfortable in the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Rustin

customer_reviews.title: Great slip on boot
customer_reviews.text: Soles are very soft but a comfortable boot. Soles worn off and I'm still wearing around the yard on dry days.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pair of boots....i have received many compliments on how strong they look
customer_reviews.author: ian manoo

customer_reviews.title: Great looking boot
customer_reviews.text: The boot is well made and it is my second pare of Dr. Martens. The non slip tread has saved me 2x. I wear a 10.5 and ordered a size that would fit a us 11. I did this since I always add a gel insert. The company shipped them on time and I would order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but no half sizes makes choosing a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, but no half sizes makes choosing a size a roll of the dice with the result either being clown shoes or binding your feet like a 14th century geisha. It's been one hundred years, guys, offer half sizes, for normalcy's sake.
customer_reviews.author: Plaid Lemur

customer_reviews.title: are comfortable, no slips and so far
customer_reviews.text: Works well, are comfortable, no slips and so far, they are working properly with no manufacturing defects.
customer_reviews.author: JARELLANO

customer_reviews.title: Awsome botas!👍
customer_reviews.text: Great boot .. probably recommend to get a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Angelp760

customer_reviews.title: actually the most comfortable Martins I have owned and I prefer them over ...
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 12 1/2 in US men's regular running shoes.. I ordered the 11uk 12 us M... They fit right on the money and worth every penny, actually the most comfortable Martins I have owned and I prefer them over my $150 Nike Shox superfly running shoes . hope this helps you guys with some of the sizing problems.
customer_reviews.author: matt carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable boot just a little big around the ankle area, other then that there a great boots
customer_reviews.author: Tony Damon

customer_reviews.title: Safety and Style in one great boot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect work boots for my husband. He is a Project Engineer and Specializes in Construction and turnarounds. They look great and the fit and finish is true to size with enough room for heavier socks in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: MujerdeFuego

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but quite stiff and not very flexible as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but quite stiff and not very flexible as docs are. Added a soft gel inner sole which does tighten the the fit somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot.
customer_reviews.text: A little big, but nothing a thicker pair of socks won’t fix. Nice boot.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Great sole
customer_reviews.text: HIgh quality soft leather with yellow stitch.I was very surprised special quality of sole. If I walked in mud place, even the mud that caught in the grove of the shoe sole peeled out naturally trace after drying.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: One of the best looking boots for tradies
customer_reviews.text: This boots distinguishes the difference between you and rest of the tradies. However, the quality isn't as good as it used to be. I've a pair of steel cap Dr. Martens which I purchased 15 years ago and it is still in a ok condition. But this one is just not as good. I notice the quality difference on the first day at the work site. I cut off a nail with a grinder and stepped on it and it melt into the rubber straight away.
customer_reviews.author: Chia-Chang LAI

customer_reviews.title: They are great boots, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This pair was purchased for a coworker (overseas) after he saw my new pair I purchased one month earlier. They are great boots, comfortable, easy on easy off and sole grips like crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable! They feel snug and stay on my feet well. I wear these around the fire station and on calls (when not in gear). They look good as well.
customer_reviews.author: m76dressler

customer_reviews.title: I bring my boots to hell with me every mon-fri ...
customer_reviews.text: I bring my boots to hell with me every mon-fri...theyre holding up well...my red wings would have hit the trashcan by now.
customer_reviews.author: frankforney

customer_reviews.title: ... bulky looking but otherwise it fits well and feels nice.
customer_reviews.text: the toe cap is is little too bulky looking but otherwise it fits well and feels nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Safire

customer_reviews.title: These boots rock!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots! I’m retired so don’t need the steel toe. With that said, they are still the most comfortable boots I have ever worn. Even right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: James M Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Work Boots 👢
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are well built and really are non slip. Initially, you have to break them in, that takes a week or so depending on wear, mine took a week. They are finally comfortable and look cool 😎.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

product_meta.title: Dr. Martens Men's Fusion Safety-Toe Chelsea Boot
product_meta.description: Dr. Martens is the stuff of legends. It all began near Munich, Germany in 1945 when Dr. Klaus Maertens injured his foot in a skiing accident in the Bavarian Alps. To make walking easier during the healing process, he designed a shoe with an air-cushioned sole. Using old rubber tires, he constructed soles that had air trapped within closed compartments. He showed his prototype to his engineer/inventor friend, Dr. Herbert Funck, and together they decided to develop and produce the shoes. Not only did the shoe solve the doctor's immediate problem, but it also started to sell well in Germany. By 1959 the two decided that they needed a company to produce and distribute the shoes, then called Dr. Maertens, in other parts of the world. At first, many manufacturers rejected the concept of an air cushioned sole as a short-lived gimmick. However, the R. Griggs Group, located in the village of Wollaston in England, decided to go along with the idea by creating the first work boot with the revolutionary sole. On the first of April 1960, the first cherry red eight-eyelet work boot was produced and named 1460. To sell the brand name better in England, the name was anglicized to Dr. Martens. The range was branded AirWair and the rest is history.
feature_bullets: Leather Chelsea boot featuring 360-degree welt stitching, gored insets on sides, and pull-on loop at back
